intro: Trevoa glauca, commonly known as the silver trevoa, is a flowering plant native to the southern regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, silver-gray leaves that are covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the spring, attracting various pollinators. Trevoa glauca is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions.
